greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: T(n, k) = Stirling1(n+1, k) - Stirling1(n, k-1), for 1 <= k <= n. Triangle read by rows.
formula: The matrix inverse of the Worpitzky triangle. More precisely:
T(n, k) = -n!*InvW(n, k) where InvW is the matrix inverse of A028246. - _Peter Luschny_, May 26 2020
maple: T := (n, k) -> Stirling1(n+1, k) - Stirling1(n, k-1);
seq(seq(T(n, k), k=1..n), n=1..9); # _Peter Luschny_, May 26 2020
results.author: _Vladeta Jovovic_, Jun 05 2004
ext: Offset of k shifted and edited by _Peter Luschny_, May 26 2020
